name: CryptoParty, Feb. 9th 2014 in Boston, MA
tagline: Encryption tools for files, messaging and more
body:
![](https://ageispolis.net/test/cryptoparty.png)
### by Kevin Gallagher ([@ageis](https://twitter.com/ageis))
## TrueCrypt
Free open-source disk encryption software for Windows 7/Vista/XP, Mac OS X, and Linux. [Is it audited yet?](http://istruecryptauditedyet.com/)

* Creates a virtual encrypted disk within a file and mounts it as a real disk. 

* Encrypts an entire partition or storage device such as USB flash drive or hard drive.

* Can encrypt a partition or drive where Windows is installed (pre-boot authentication).

* Provides plausible deniability, in case an adversary forces you to reveal the password (hidden volume or operating system).

How to: [create volumes](https://securityinabox.org/en/truecrypt_standardvolumes#2.2), [mount volumes](https://securityinabox.org/en/truecrypt_mountstandardvolume), [use hidden volumes](https://securityinabox.org/en/truecrypt_hiddenvolumes).

### [Download](http://www.truecrypt.org/downloads)

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/truecrypt_ss.png)

## FileVault
Provided by Apple on Mac operating systems, under System Preferences → Security & Privacy.

* **[FileVault 1](http://support.apple.com/kb/ph7031)**: available in OS X versions 10.3 to 10.6. Encrypts a user's home directory.

* **[FileVault 2](http://support.apple.com/kb/ht4790)**: OS X Lion (10.7) and later. Full disk, XTS-AES 128 encryption.

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/filevault_ss.png)

## [BitLocker](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows7/products/features/bitlocker)
Provided by Microsoft on Windows 7 Ultimate and Enterprise Edition, and Windows 8 Pro and Enterprise under Control Panel → System and Security

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/bitlocker_ss.png)

## [Gpg4win](http://www.gpg4win.org/)
Includes a tool called GNU Privacy Assistant with an interface that can encrypt, decrypt, sign and verify files.

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/gpa_ss.png)

## [LUKS](https://code.google.com/p/cryptsetup/)
Linux Unified Key Setup

* Standard for Linux hard disk encryption.

* Included in the installer of many modern distributions.

* Cryptsetup utility supports many types of encrypted volumes.

Example:
```
$ apt-get install cryptsetup
$ cryptsetup luksFormat /dev/sda1
$ cryptsetup luksOpen /dev/sda1 data
$ mkfs.ext4 /dev/mapper/data
$ mount -t ext4 /dev/mapper/data /media/data
$ update-initramfs -u
```
Also check out [eCryptfs](http://ecryptfs.org/).

## Off-the-record messaging (OTR)
Popular protocol for encryption, authentication, deniability, and perfect forward secrecy of instant messaging.

**[Adium](https://adium.im/)** for Mac OS X

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/adium_ss.png)

**[Pidgin](http://pidgin.im/)** with [pidgin-otr](https://otr.cypherpunks.ca/) plugin (Windows and Linux)

How to: [use OTR with Pidgin](https://securityinabox.org/en/pidgin_securechat).

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/pidgin_ss.png)

**[Jitsi](https://jitsi.org/)** works too, and it's available for every OS!

How to: [use OTR with Jitsi](https://securityinabox.org/en/jitsi_communicate#3.2).

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/jitsi_ss.png)

### Mobile
Android: **[Xabber](http://www.xabber.org/)** or ChatSecure

iPhone: **[ChatSecure](https://chatsecure.org/)**

## Secure calls and texts

Get **RedPhone** and **TextSecure** for Android, both from [Open Whisper Systems](https://whispersystems.org/). Coming soon to iPhone.

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/redphone_ss.png)
![](https://ageispolis.net/test/textsecure_ss.png)

## Browser extensions

**[HTTPS Everywhere](https://www.eff.org/https-everywhere)** tells your browser to always request a secure connection if it's available.

**[CryptoCat](https://crypto.cat/)** offers easy to use and accessible encrypted chat, as a browser app.

![](https://ageispolis.net/test/cryptocat_ss.png)

**[Mailvelope](http://www.mailvelope.com/)** provides OpenPGP encryption for Google and Yahoo webmail.

For more privacy-oriented plugins, see also: [Ghostery](https://www.ghostery.com/), [Disconnect](https://disconnect.me/), [Lightbeam](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/lightbeam/), [AdBlock Plus](https://adblockplus.org/), [DoNotTrackMe, MaskMe, and DeleteMe](https://abine.com/products/index.php) and [DuckDuckGo](https://duckduckgo.com/).

## Miscellaneous

**[SpiderOak](https://spideroak.com/)** and **[CrashPlan](http://www.code42.com/crashplan/)** are both encryption-friendly backup services.

**[7-Zip](http://www.7-zip.org/)** can create AES-256 encrypted archives!

**[KeePass](http://www.keepass.info/)** is a free open source password manager with an encrypted database.

## Stuff to watch

I'm excited about things like [SecureDrop](https://pressfreedomfoundation.org/securedrop), [LEAP Encryption Access Project](https://pressfreedomfoundation.org/organization/leap-encryption-access-project), [mailpile](https://www.mailpile.is/), the [Dark Mail Technical Alliance](http://darkmail.info/), [GlobalLeaks](https://globaleaks.org/), [ownCloud](http://owncloud.org/), [Pond](https://pond.imperialviolet.org/), [Bitmessage](https://bitmessage.org/wiki/Main_Page), [Tahoe-LAFS](https://tahoe-lafs.org/trac/tahoe-lafs) and [Enigmabox](http://enigmabox.net/en/)!
